title: Police: Toddler's shooting appears accidental, self-inflicted
content:
KANSAS CITY, Mo. —
A 3-year-old girl who was critically injured Wednesday after being shot inside a home near 38th Street and Chestnut Avenue appears to have fired the gun herself, police said.
Teriah Davis suffered a gunshot wound to the stomach and was taken to an area hospital for treatment of her injuries. She underwent surgery Wednesday afternoon.
Police said it appears Teriah's 5-year-old brother found the gun in another room of the house, took it to where she was playing and she wound up firing it and hitting herself.
Investigators said the gun belonged to Teriah's mother's boyfriend, who was in the house when the shooting took place.
Police said the case file will likely be sent to the Jackson County Prosecutor's Office on Friday to consider whether any charges will be filed.
